original_title: Was never pressured by India: Maithripala
original_body_lines: Former President Maithripala Sirisena said he was not pressured to implement legislations by any country, as he had maintained close ties with them.
"Personally neither Premier Modi nor the Indian government pressured me. Whether India, China, Russia, America, Japan or Germany, I had maintained close ties with all these countries," he said.
"It is an art that political leaders must possess," he said.
He added that consecutive governments have failed to review the suitability of the local government system.
